Printing a tibble: Tracking control flow

Source: vignettes/debugme.Rmd
debugme.Rmd

What happens when a tibble is printed? This vignette shows the actual control flow, powered by the debugme package. See vignette("printing") for a detailed description of the control and data flows.

To activate debugging, we need to set an environment variable before loading the pillar package. As a result, debug strings in pillar’s code are replaced with calls to a logging function.

By default, debugme also shows timestamps. This is disabled to keep the output stable.

Sys.setenv(DEBUGME = "!!!!pillar")
Sys.setenv(DEBUGME_SHOW_TIMESTAMP = "no")

library(pillar)
#> pillar Loaded 
#> pillar Level 2 +1ms 
#> pillar Level 3 +1ms 
#> pillar Level 4 +1ms

tbl <- tibble::tibble(a = 1:3, b = tibble::tibble(c = 4:6, d = 7:9), e = 10:12)
print(tbl, width = 23)
#> pillar tbl_format_setup() +155ms 
#> pillar +-tbl_format_setup.tbl() +1ms 
#> pillar   +-ctl_colonnade() +3ms 
#> pillar     +-ctl_new_compound_pillar(width = 21, title = "a") +8ms 
#> pillar       +-ctl_new_compound_pillar.tbl(width = 21, title = "a") +3ms 
#> pillar         +-ctl_new_pillar(width = 21, title = "a") +3ms 
#> pillar           +-ctl_new_pillar.tbl(width = 21, title = "a") +3ms 
#> pillar             +-pillar(title = "a", width = 21) +3ms 
#> pillar               +-new_pillar_title(x = "a") +3ms 
#> pillar               +-new_pillar_type(class(x) = "integer") +32ms 
#> pillar               +-pillar_shaft(class(x) = "integer") +4ms 
#> pillar               +-new_pillar_component(x = <list: <pllr_sh_>>, width = 1L, min_width = 1L) +37ms 
#> pillar               +-new_pillar(width = 21, class = NULL) +3ms
